string-array.name: recipe_pasta_steps
string-array.item: Cook pasta according to package instructions.
In a saucepan, melt butter over medium heat and sauté garlic for 1 minute until fragrant.
Stir in heavy cream and bring to a simmer. Cook for 2–3 minutes.
Reduce heat, stir in Parmesan cheese until the sauce is smooth.
Drain the pasta and toss it with the creamy garlic sauce. Garnish with parsley.

string-array.name: recipe_pancakes_steps
string-array.item: In a large bowl, whisk together flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt.
In a separate bowl, whisk together milk and egg, then stir in the melted butter.
Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and stir until just combined. Do not overmix.
Heat a lightly oiled griddle or frying pan over medium-high heat.
Pour or scoop the batter onto the griddle, using approximately ¼ cup for each pancake.
Cook until bubbles form and the edges are dry, then flip and cook until golden brown.

string-array.name: recipe_tacos_steps
string-array.item: In a large skillet, cook ground beef over medium-high heat until no longer pink. Drain fat.
Stir in taco seasoning and water. Bring to a simmer and cook for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally, until sauce has thickened.
While the meat is cooking, heat taco shells according to package directions.
Spoon the beef mixture into the warm taco shells.
Top with lettuce, tomatoes, cheese, and sour cream as desired.

string-array.name: recipe_cookies_steps
string-array.item: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Line baking sheets with parchment paper.
In a small bowl, whisk together flour, baking soda, and salt.
In a large bowl, beat the softened butter, granulated sugar, brown sugar, and vanilla extract with an electric mixer until creamy.
Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition.
Gradually beat in the flour mixture until just combined. Stir in the chocolate chips.
Drop rounded tablespoons of dough onto the prepared baking sheets, about 2 inches apart.
Bake for 9 to 11 minutes, or until golden brown. Let cool on baking sheets for 2 minutes before transferring to wire racks to cool completely.

string-array.name: recipe_soup_steps
string-array.item: Heat olive oil in a large pot or Dutch oven over medium heat.
Add chopped onion and cook until softened, about 5–7 minutes.
Stir in garlic and cook for another minute until fragrant.
Pour in the crushed tomatoes, vegetable broth, and basil. Season with salt and pepper.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for at least 20 minutes to allow flavors to meld.
If using, stir in the heavy cream before serving. For a smoother soup, use an immersion blender.

string-array.name: recipe_guacamole_steps
string-array.item: Halve the avocados, remove the pits, and scoop the flesh into a medium bowl.
Mash the avocado with a fork to your desired consistency (chunky or smooth).
Stir in the chopped onion, chiles, cilantro, lime juice, and salt.
Taste and adjust seasoning if necessary. Add more lime juice or salt as needed.

string-array.name: recipe_chicken_ingredients
string-array.item: 1 head of garlic, cut in half crosswise
Salt and freshly ground black pepper

string-array.name: recipe_chicken_steps
string-array.item: Pat the chicken dry with paper towels. Season generously inside and out with salt and pepper.
Stuff the cavity of the chicken with the lemon halves, rosemary, thyme, and garlic head.
Truss the chicken legs together with kitchen twine.
Rub the outside of the chicken with olive oil.
Place the chicken in a roasting pan and roast for 1 hour to 1 hour 15 minutes, or until the juices run clear.
Let the chicken rest for 10–15 minutes before carving.

string-array.name: recipe_pizza_ingredients
string-array.item: 1 lb pizza dough, store-bought or homemade
½ cup pizza sauce or crushed tomatoes

string-array.name: recipe_pizza_steps
string-array.item: Preheat your oven to its highest setting, typically 500–550°F (260–290°C), with a pizza stone or steel inside if you have one.
On a lightly floured surface, stretch or roll out the pizza dough to your desired thickness.
Transfer the dough to a piece of parchment paper.
Spread the pizza sauce evenly over the dough, leaving a small border for the crust.
Arrange the mozzarella slices on top of the sauce. Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with salt.
Carefully slide the pizza (on the parchment) onto the preheated pizza stone or a baking sheet.
Bake for 8–12 minutes, or until the crust is golden and the cheese is bubbly and slightly browned.
Top with fresh basil leaves before serving.

string-array.name: recipe_garlic_bread_ingredients
string-array.item: 1 loaf of French bread or baguette
½ cup (1 stick) unsalted butter, softened

string-array.name: recipe_garlic_bread_steps
string-array.item: Slice the loaf of bread in half lengthwise.
In a small bowl, mix together the softened butter, minced garlic, chopped parsley, and salt until well combined.
Spread the garlic butter mixture evenly over both cut sides of the bread.
Place the bread halves on a baking sheet, buttered side up.
Bake for 10–12 minutes, or until the butter is melted and the edges are golden brown.
For crispier bread, you can broil for the last 1–2 minutes, watching carefully to prevent burning.

string-array.name: recipe_salad_ingredients
string-array.item: 1 head of romaine lettuce, washed and chopped

string-array.name: recipe_salad_steps
string-array.item: In a large salad bowl, combine the chopped lettuce, cucumber, cherry tomatoes, and red onion.
To make the vinaigrette, whisk together the olive oil, red wine vinegar, and Dijon mustard in a small bowl.
Season the vinaigrette with salt and pepper to your liking.
Pour the vinaigrette over the salad just before serving.
Toss gently to combine all ingredients.
Serve immediately as a side or a light main course.
